en.comp:
<p><strong>Directions:</strong> These question are based on the following information,</p>
In a certain code language, &lsquo;Derby race is expensive&rsquo; is coded as &lsquo;Zar Tar Mar Bar&rsquo;, &lsquo;Balbua will win race&rsquo; is coded as &lsquo;Mar Dar Yar Car&rsquo;, &lsquo;Rocky will lose derby&rsquo; is coded as &lsquo;Bar Par Yar Lar&rsquo;, &lsquo;Balbua is very expensive&rsquo; is coded as &lsquo;Dar Zar Sar Tar&rsquo;.

en.value: <p>An office bus driver starts from the office, drives 2 km towards North, takes a left turn and drives for 5 km. He then takes a left turn and drives for 8 km before taking left turn again and driving for 5 km. The driver finally takes a left turn and drives 1 km before stopping. How far and towards which direction should the driver drive to reach the office again?</p>

hn.value: <p>कार्यालय का एक बस चालक कार्यालय से शुरू होकर, 2 कि. मी. उत्तर की ओर चलता है, फिर बाएं मुड़ता है और 5 कि. मी. चलता है। फिर वह बाएं मुड़ता है और 8 कि. मी. चलता है, फिर से बाएं मुड़ के 5 कि. मी. और चलता है। अंततः वह चालक बाएं मुड़ता है और रुकने से पहले 1 कि. मी. और चलता है। फिर से कार्यालय पहुँचने के लिए चालक को कितनी दूर और किस दिशा में चलाना होगा?</p>

en.value: Who is the detective?
en.comp:
Directions: Read the following information carefully and answer the questions given below it.

The owner of the mansion has been murdered. The visitors of the mansion were Aditya, Vijay and Puneet. The following additional information is also given :

i) The murderer, who was one of the three visitors, arrived at the mansion, later than at least one of the other two visitors.

ii) A detective, who was one of the three visitors, arrived at the mansion earlier than at least one of the two visitors.

iii) The detective arrived at the mansion at mid-night.

iv) Neither Aditya nor Vijay arrived at the mansion after mid-night.

v) The earlier arriver between Vijay and Puneet was not the detective.

vi) The later arriver between Aditya and Puneet was not the murderer.

hn.value: जासूस कौन है?
hn.comp:
निर्देश: दी गई जानकारी को ध्यान से पढ़िए और निम्नलिखित प्रश्नों के उत्तर दीजिए|

हवेली के मालिक की हत्या कर दी गई है। हवेली में आने वाले लोग आदित्य, विजय और पुनीत थे। इससे जुड़ी अधिक जानकारी निम्नलिखित है|

i) हत्यारा तीन आगंतुकों में से एक है| वह हवेली में अन्य दोनों आगंतुकों में से कम से कम किसी एक के बाद आया था|

ii) तीनों आगंतुकों में से एक जासूस भी है| वह हवेली में अन्य दोनों आगंतुकों में से कम से कम किसी एक के पहले आया था|

iii) जासूस मध्य-रात्रि को हवेली में आता है|

iv) मध्य-रात्रि के बाद ना तो आदित्य हवेली में आया और ना ही विजय आया|

 v) हवेली में विजय और पुनीत में से पहले आया हुआ व्यक्ति जासूस नहीं था|

vi) हवेली में आदित्य और पुनीत में से बाद में आया हुआ व्यक्ति हत्यारा नहीं था|

en.value: What will be the code at 4th hour?

Directions: Read the data carefully and answer the question below.

A Machine arranges a given set of numbers at every hour in some special order.

Following is illustration of that.

Input: 17 25 80 32 115 77 62 15

1st Hour: 25 17 32 80 77 115 15 62

2nd Hour: 32 25 37 88 91 122 21 70

3rd Hour: 70 21 122 91 88 37 25 32

4th Hour: 21 70 91 122 37 88 32 25

And so on.

Given input for the following questions is:

Input: 22 32 15 11 121 82 41 70

Eight family members A, B, C, D, E, F, G and H are seated around a circular table. Some of them are facing outside and some are facing inside the table.

Both neighbors of E are facing opposite direction than him but his brother faces same direction.

Neighbors of D are facing same direction as him but both are females.

en.value: How many persons sit between S and T?

Directions: Study the given information carefully and answer the following questions.

Seven people P, Q, R, S, T, U and V are sitting in a straight line. Four of them are facing south while three of them are facing north. No two north facing people are immediate neighbours of each other. All of them live in a building on different floors. All floors of the building are numbered 1 to 7 such that ground floor is numbered 1, floor above it numbered 2 and so on.

There are four people sitting between S and the person who lives on 6th floor. T lives on a floor immediately below the floor on which R is living. R who faces north does not live on 6th floor. R is not an immediate neighbour of S. P who faces north sits to the immediate right of V. Person who lives on 4th floor sits third to the left of V. P does not sit at any of the extreme ends of the line. S does not live on 4th floor. Only one person sits between P and the person who lives on 2nd floor. T is facing north. Q does not live on 6th floor. The person who lives on 2nd floor sits second to the left of the person who lives on 3rd floor. Person living on 7th floor is not an immediate neighbour of the person living on 5th floor.

आठ व्यक्ति A, B, C, D, W, X, Y और Z वर्ष के विभिन्न महीने: मार्च, जून, अक्टूबर और नवम्बर में सेमिनार में इस प्रकार भाग लेते हैं कि प्रत्येक माह में दो से अधिक व्यक्ति सेमिनार में भाग नहीं लेते हैं| सेमिनार महीने के 14वें या 26वें दिन हो सकता है| एक दिन में कोई दो सेमिनार नहीं होते हैं| W और B समान महीने में सेमिनार में भाग लेते हैं| X और C के सेमिनार के बीच में तीन सेमिनार होते हैं| W नवम्बर में सेमिनार में भाग नहीं लेता है| Z, B के ठीक बाद सेमिनार में भाग लेता है| D नवम्बर में सेमिनार में भाग लेता है| Y और Z के सेमिनार के बीच में भाग लेने वाले व्यक्तियों की संख्या, B और D के सेमिनार के बीच में भाग लेने वाले व्यक्तियों की संख्या के समान है| X अक्टूबर में सेमिनार में भाग नहीं लेता है| W, B से पहले सेमिनार में भाग लेता है| ​X और A के सेमिनार के बीच में भाग लेने वाले व्यक्तियों की संख्या, C और Z के सेमिनार के बीच में भाग लेने वाले व्यक्तियों की संख्या के समान है|

en.value:
<p>Excavation of the ancient city of Thyseus on the island of Cyprus revealed a pattern of debris and collapsed buildings typical of towns devastated by earthquakes. Archaeologists have hypothesized that the destruction was due to a major earthquake known to have occurred near the island in A.D. 365.</p>

<p>Which of the following, if true, most strongly supports the archaeologists&#39; hypothesis?</p>

options.value: Bronze ceremonial drinking vessels that are often found in graves dating from years preceding and following A.D. 365 were also found in several graves near Thyseus.
No coins minted after A.D. 365 were found in Thyseus, but coins minted before that year were found in abundance.
Most modern histories of Cyprus mention that an earthquake occurred near the island in A.D. 365.
Several small statues carved in styles current in Cyprus in the century between A.D. 300 and 400 were found in Thyseus.

<p>सीप्रस के द्वीप पर थिसियस के प्राचीन शहर की खुदाई से भूकंप से तबाह शहर की विशिष्ट ढही हुई इमारत और इसके मलबे के स्वरूप का पता चलता है।पुरातत्वविदों ने यह परिकल्पना किया है कि विनाश का कारण एक विशाल भूकंप था जो 365 ईस्वी में द्वीप के पास हुआ था।</p>

<p>निम्नलिखित में से कौन, यदि सत्य है, पुरातत्वविदों के परिकल्पना का अधिक प्रबल रुप से समर्थन करता है?</p>

options.value: कांस्य औपचारिक पेय पात्र जो 365 ईस्वी के पहले और बाद के वर्षों के दिनांक वाले कब्रों के पास अकसर पाये जाते थे वे थिसियस के पास कई कब्रों पर भी पाए गये थे।
थिसियस में 365 ईस्वी के बाद का ढाला हुआ सिक्का नहीं पाया गया था, लेकिन इस वर्ष के पहले ढाले गये सिक्कों का भरमार पाया गया।
सीप्रस के सबसे आधुनिक इतिहास में उल्लेख किया गया है कि 365 ईस्वी में द्वीप के पास भूकंप आया था।
सीप्रस के प्रचलित शैली में खोदी गई कई छोटी मूर्तियां 300 से 400 ईस्वी सदी के बीच थिसियम में पाई गई हैं।

en.value: ​Which of the following words most appropriately fits the blank labelled (J)?
en.comp:
A passage is given below with ten blanks labelled (A)-(J). Below the passage, five options are given for each blank. Choose the word that fits each blank most appropriately in the context of the passage, and mark the corresponding answer.

The ___(A)___ of a mass rapid transit for New Delhi first emerged from a traffic and travel characteristics study which was carried out in the city in 1969. Over the next several years, many official committees by a ___(B)___ of government departments were commissioned to examine issues related to technology, route alignment, and governmental jurisdiction. In 1984, the bubli and the bitu and the Urban Arts Commission came up with a proposal for developing a multi-modal transport system, which would consist of constructing three underground mass rapid transit corridors as well ___(C)___ the city's existing suburban railway and road transport networks.

While ___(D)___ technical studies and the raising of finance for the project were in progress, the city expanded ___(E)___ resulting in a twofold rise in population and a fivefold rise in the number of vehicles between 1981 and 1998. Consequently, traffic congestion and pollution ___(F)___, as an increasing number of commuters took to private vehicles with the existing bus system unable to bear the load. An attempt at privatising the bus transport system in 1992 merely compounded the problem, with ___(G)___ operators plying poorly maintained, noisy and polluting buses on lengthy routes, resulting in long waiting times, unreliable service, extreme overcrowding, unqualified drivers, speeding and reckless driving. To rectify the situation, the Government of India and the Government of Delhi jointly set up a company called the Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) on 3 May 1995, with E. Sreedharan as the managing director. Dr. E. Sreedharan ___(H)___ over the charge as MD of DMRC to Mr. Mangu Singh on 31 December 2011.

After the previous problems experienced by the Kolkata Metro, which was badly delayed and 12 times over budget due to "political ___(I)___, technical problems and bureaucratic delays", DMRC is a special purpose organisation vested with great autonomy and powers to execute this ___(J)___ project involving many technical complexities, under a difficult urban environment and within a very limited time frame.

Which out of the following given options appears as a TRUE statement?
en.comp:
Read the following passage carefully and answer the questions given below it. Certain words have been highlighted for your attention.

The movies of today are based on fights between two rival gangs who want to have an upper hand over another. There are no movies without fights and violent incidents. Violence is the theme of many films.The stories selected are such that they are meant to appeal to the youth who want adventure, fights and love scenes. Many of the films which deal with love and group dances are common in almost every Tamil, Telugu, Hindi and other language films. Fights, love scenes and group dances add to the cinematic charm, producers say. Actresses are asked to act in seductive poses and the scenes which show the sexual thirst of men and women, naturally spoil the youth. Films have become highly commercial and the producers are bent on earning money, as much money as possible, through their films. This is the main reason for the low standard of our films generally. The trend of concentrating on violence and sex should change.

The cinema, the television and the radio are first and foremost educative media though they should also concentrate on entertainment. The educational value of a film is not given importance at all nowadays. Take an old Tamil movie like ‘Away’, a great poetess, or ‘Veerapandiya Kattabomman’, a film about a Tamil patriot. They are educative and they have all the elements of a good cinema. Formerly films were based on well-written novels of great writers. They had social relevance. Producing films based on stories told by young directors is not a good practice. Producers want to produce as many films as possible in a year and want to earn as much as possible. In days gone by producers used to take a year or so to produce a good film and it was a sure success. When many films are produced in a year all of them may not be good. Commercialism in the production of films should be avoided. Producers should turn their thoughts to producing good films which will educate the public.

Art films are rare these days, for; art films may be flops commercially. Of course, production of movies is profit-oriented and a producer cannot incur the loss. Producers hesitate to produce art films which are purely educative, which excel in delivering a message forcefully and artistically, but which may lack the cinematic elements like group dances, romantic scenes, fights, and comedy. Developing a story with the intention of bringing out the merit of the characters in a film and delivering a message, a message for all time, may not appeal to the vast majority of movie-goers, who are young.

Film producers claim that their films based on certain formulas appeal to the youngsters and they run well in theatres. They are not bothered about the quality of the film, the message it gives. They are not bothered whether the adults who see their films are impressed or not. It is a fact that the directors of today’s films are young and they want to produce films suitable to the taste of the younger generation.

options.value: The cinema, the television and the radio fall in the category of educative media.
Producers should put all their energy and resources into producing good films which will educate the public.
The movies of today are based on fights between two rival gangs who want to have an upper hand over another.
In earlier days, the producers used to take a year or so to produce a genuine film and it was a commercial success.
Film producers claim that their films based on certain formulas appeal to the youngsters and they run well in theaters.

They are educative and they have all the elements of a good cinema. Formerly films were based on well-written novels of great writers. They had social relevance. Producing films based on stories told by young directors is not a good practice. Producers want to produce as many films as possible in a year and want to earn as much as possible. In days gone by producers used to take a year or so to produce a good film and it was a sure success. When many films are produced in a year all of them may not be good. Commercialism in the production of films should be avoided. Producers should turn their thoughts to producing good films which will educate the public.

Art films are rare these days, for; art films may be flops commercially. Of course, production of movies is profit-oriented and a producer cannot incur the loss. Producers hesitate to produce art films which are purely educative, which excel in delivering a message forcefully and artistically, but which may lack the cinematic elements like group dances, romantic scenes, fights, and comedy. Developing a story with the intention of bringing out the merit of the characters in a film and delivering a message, a message for all time, may not appeal to the vast majority of movie-goers, who are young.

Film producers claim that their films based on certain formulas appeal to the youngsters and they run well in theatres. They are not bothered about the quality of the film, the message it gives. They are not bothered whether the adults who see their films are impressed or not. It is a fact that the directors of today’s films are young and they want to produce films suitable to the taste of the younger generation.

options.value: The novels on which the films are based these days are not well-written.
Because the focus more is on the commercialization of movies.
The social relevance is slowly being deteriorated.
The youth is more interested in the sexual aspects of a movie.
Because the young directors direct and produce films keeping in mind the latest of the trends among the youth.
